main event: A sighting of an unidentifiable object was reported on July 6, 1949 in Fort Worth, Texas. The object was observed for 15 seconds and was described as silver, semi-transparent, and spherical in shape, similar to a soap bubble.
interesting points: The observer, a 1st Lt., was considered reliable and had formal AEC clearance.
The description of the object resembled that of a child's soap bubble, with no sound or exhaust trail.
The object was flying at approximately 300 MPH in a horizontal plane from South to North.
Radar sight unit at Carswell AFB released a balloon at the same time, which might explain the sighting.
No physical evidence or photographs were obtained for further analysis.
sighted object: unidentifiable object, described as silver, semi-transparent, and spherical in shape
witnesses: 1st Lt. who was considered reliable due to formal AEC clearance
